occupation: Chief Executive Officer at Grey-box - social innovation
headline: CEO @ Grey-Box.ca // New Founders to Watch 2022 & Researcher in Bioethics (Public Health School)
summary:
Valentin Kravtchenko has 7 years of experience in project management and over a decade in communication - with a focus on new media, new technologies, and social entrepreneurship. 

He founded Grey-Box.ca, a social innovation startup that provides free WiFi access to educational resources in remote areas where access to the Internet and electricity is inconsistent (50% of the world's population is disconnected according to the UN Broadband Commission).

He specializes in the management of projects that involve creative and technical components. He trains and supports clients in their content creation strategies for the digital age. 

He also masters the occult art of "growth hacking" but chooses to use it for good. In his free time, Valentin is involved in community organizations such as Montreal Newtech all the while acting as a stealth paladin (chaotic neutral).

Valentin was named Person of the Year by Times Magazine in 2006 (and so were you)

experiences.title: IT Project Manager
experiences.description:
• Lead the evaluation and decision process of business intelligence tools (platforms) that were used to manage and display data and insights
• Help develop, build out and automate reports/dashboards across properties that provide insights into our audience (i.e. content consumption, topic performance, engagement/loyalty, traffic).
• Provide data-driven insights to inform our broader content and business strategy  and drive decisions across distributed platforms (eg. Youtube), social media (eg. Instagram)  and the website 
• Collaborate cross-functionally with “circle” project teams within the organization to help teams achieve their Key Result goals
• Apply data mining and information gathering techniques to identify and interpret patterns and trends in visitor and subscriber behaviour on the website
• Identify new growth opportunities and best practices based on emerging digital trends, competitive business intelligence and consumer insight

experiences.title: Video Production Manager
experiences.description:
Manage the video production pipeline of Valnet's YouTube division  -  10 channels, 17 million subscribers and 450 million views per month. 
• Manage the video production unit (200 freelancers on 20 timezones) • Optimize video production processes in order to be able to output 300% more videos in 4 months (15 videos a day) as a consequence to Valnet's rapid growth • Manage video production coordinators and QAs for each channel • Hiring and training new content producers • Coordinate the content strategy with channel managers and data analysts • Follow ups, follow ups and more follow ups.

experiences.title: Video Production Coordinator
experiences.description:
Coordinate the video production on TheRichest - the biggest YouTube channel of ValnetInc with 6 million subscribers and one of the top 100 channel on YouTube. 
• Manage a team of freelance video producers (25 people on 6 timezones) • Optimize video production process in order to be able to output 30% more videos (3 videos a day) • Track and manage video production progress • Quality assurance for all videos • Send final cuts to Channel Manager for uploading and scheduling • Follow and apply guidelines sent by Channel Manager to ensure the videos are optimized

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Le Prix du Doyen dans la catégorie "Solidarité"
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: Le Prix du Doyen dans la catégorie "Solidarité" a été décerné à Gabrielle Veilleux-Verreault et Valentin Kravtchenko qui se sont distingués par leur participation active à une levée de fonds et des activités bénévoles au sein de la communauté ukrainienne ici à Montréal puis en Pologne, afin d'aider les victimes des conflits ukrainiens-russes à se procurer des besoins de première nécessités. Ils ont fait preuve d'humanité et de créativité avec la production d'une vidéo présentant les différents visages de ceux et celles qui sont solidaires avec la nation Ukrainienne. Toute la communauté de l'École salue leur implication.

recommendations:
Poojan Shukla



I joined Grey-Box as a Digital Marketing volunteer. I would highly recommend Grey-Box's Volunteer Program for their exceptional work-integrated learning work-culture. Their unique approach of combining theoretical knowledge with practical experience helped me invaluably to enter the workforce in the starting of my career. 

At Grey-Box, I was welcomed with a supportive and an inclusive environment for learning, and their commitment to their volunteer's success is truly remarkable. I was actively involved at all steps in the Marketing team and it also allowed me to take up initiatives with great help from Valentin and the team, that accurately aligned with my interests at the time.

Farshad (Fred) Rouhani



I vividly remember the day Valentin was scheduled to do a workshop for our cohort of social entrepreneurs. He was stuck in an airport, in another timezone, facing delays and lots of complications. He went above and beyond! Not only managed to do the workshop on time but also delivered superb content. The cohort went out of the workshop with concepts, best practices and tools that boosted their scale up strategy. You're a bundle of commitment and knowledge Valentin! Looking forward to working with you again.
